meanings.definition: To adjust or make changes to a device or system to ensure accuracy or proper functioning.
meanings.sent1: She recalibrates the scale to make sure it shows the correct weight.
meanings.sent2: He recalibrates the compass before every hiking trip.
meanings.sent3: The robot recalibrates itself, but sometimes it gets confused and walks into walls.
meanings.sent4: His perspective recalibrates when he sees the world from a different angle.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic recalibrates the engine, making it run smoother than ever before.

meanings.definition: To make small changes or corrections to something in order to improve its performance or accuracy.
meanings.sent1: The teacher recalibrates the lesson plan based on student feedback.
meanings.sent2: She recalibrates her watch to match the correct time.
meanings.sent3: The chef recalibrates the recipe, adding a pinch of salt for good luck.
meanings.sent4: His heart recalibrates its rhythm when he hears her voice on the phone.
meanings.sent5: The artist recalibrates the colors, creating a masterpiece that captures the essence of nature.
